title: Have face masks failed in the battle against Covid-19? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thank you, my friend, for asking me to reply to your question. The failure to prevent the widespread contagion of the coronavirus isn’t nearly as much due to the failure of the masks to prevent the dissemination of the virus, as it is a failure of people to wear the masks. A Gallup poll, released July 6th, 2020 reported 11% of Americans steadfastly refuse to wear a mask. Short of herd immunity, accomplished naturally, or by inoculation with a vaccine, about the only things we can do to slow the spread of a virus, is to social distance, wear masks, wash our hands frequently, use hand sanitizer when we are unable to wash, and self-quarantine if we become ill. A study performed by the Clark County Board of Health revealed if an infected person weren’t wearing a mask, and a healthy person was wearing a mask, the healthy person stood a 70% chance of becoming infected. Yet, if both people were wearing a mask, the healthy person stood only a 2% chance of contracting the viral contagion. While observing every health precaution issued by the CDC and the NIH is not 100% effective…observing the health precautions does slow the spread of the virus, and it does save lives. Included in those health precautions was the advise to wear the N 95 or the KN 95 masks. Anything less effective would be unsuccessful I hope you remain healthy, my friend, and enjoy a wonderful Morning.

No, face masks succeeded in many countries. The purpose of the mask was to slow the spread of Corona virus. Many countries were able to flatten the curve on their first wave. Canada was one of those countries. Unfortunately, we relaxed too much over the summer and now we are in a deadly second wave that is threatening to overwhelm our hospitals in some parts of the country. Even the Maritimes, which had done extremely well at keeping the virus out are now having increasing cases. BC, Manitoba and other provinces had very low case rates and now we are having spreader events. Yesterday BC had over 200 new cases in a 24 hour period, the highest so far. I am very concerned that people are not reverting to good health practices fast enough. Please for everyone’s sake, wear your mask, social distance, wash your hands frequently and restrict your activities with others to small groups. Good luck to us all

No, in fact they are probably more effective at preventing the virus from invading your system than any vaccine will prove to be. (masks 95% vaccine c. 65%). The failure has come from people resisting wearing them when they should wear them. They for some damn reason have decided that it is a political statement rather than something done as a health necessity.

If you are out in the rain with an umbrella, and a truck drives through a puddle next to you and drenches you from head to toe, you don’t ask, “Have umbrellas failed?” Facemasks have done exactly what facemasks do during infectious disease outbreaks: slow the spread. They’ve only “failed” in that we haven’t taken any of the real steps to stop the spread of the disease that the countries who have COVID-19 under control have taken, and so the disease continues to spread.

Masks haven’t failed at all, because they were never touted as being a foolproof solution that would halt the spread of the virus. Marks are intended to reduce the spread, and tests have found them to be effective in that role. Citing the global increase in the infection rate as evidence that they don’t work doesn’t make sense, as there are multiple factors at play here, and if nobody wore masks we would expect see an even more rapid worsening of the situation.
